metadata.synopsis: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.

28.speaker: Brem
28.text: Something I can help you with?

48.speaker: Brem
48.text: Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I'm here to buy your prisoner.

58.speaker: Brem
58.text: I doubt you've got that kinda dosh lying about. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

19.speaker: Brem
19.text: He's all yours. Don't forget to feed him - he bawls something proper.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I don't have that kind of money.

99.speaker: Brem
99.text: Been there, mate. Come back when you've coin, and we can talk, eh?

110.speaker: Player
110.text: You're insane if you think I'm going to pay that much.

80.speaker: Brem
80.text: All right, so maybe I was fishing. No fooling you. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

63.speaker: Brem
63.text:
Aye, off my rocker me - so you'd best not push me too far, eh? Price is the price. 
([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I don't have that much gold. I have plenty of steel, though.

6.speaker: Brem
6.text: All right mate, all right. Waukeen's clipped coins, there's no need to get arsey.

75.speaker: Brem
75.text: Go on then. But anything lower would be criminal. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

3.speaker: Brem
3.text: Oh? More steel than the entire Zhentarim? Cos that's who you're crossing if you try to scab me on a deal.

42.speaker: Brem
42.text: The price is the price. Pay up or get lost.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Too much. Cut your price down to size or I'll cut you down to size.

9.speaker: Brem
9.text: Then what? You going to kill the entire Zhentarim next? Good luck, prick.

53.speaker: Brem
53.text: Then it's the same price I gave you before. No more haggling. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I don't have that kind of money.

94.speaker: Brem
94.text: Well don't you cut a fine figure. Want your portrait done?

26.speaker: Brem
26.text: If you have the gold, my pet artist will make you a most heroical likeness.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: It's not the art I want to buy - it's the artist.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: He's not a pet, he's a prisoner - let him go.

60.speaker: Brem
60.text: Let's say we're his patrons, yeah? Found him wandering the wilds alone.

101.speaker: Brem
101.text: He needs protection. And if his paintings cover our costs - so much the better, eh?

100.speaker: Player
100.text: 'Protection'. It sounds a bit more like kidnapping.

31.speaker: Brem
31.text: You looking to buy him? I'm open to offers, mate. Threats, not so much.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Fine, I'll buy him. How much?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: We can skip threats and go straight to blades, if you like.

10.speaker: Brem
10.text: All right mate, all right - no need to get arsey about it.

66.speaker: Brem
66.text: Look, mate - this don't have to get violent, right? You want him, pay for him.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: If he's as talented as you say, someone will be looking for him.

7.speaker: Brem
7.text: These artsy tossers always have friends in high places. That's why they're valuable.

1.speaker: Brem
1.text: But... aye. Might be we've drawn enough attention to this place.

12.speaker: Brem
12.text: Take the moany bastard, if he means that much to ya. Doubt his crap would sell anyway.

56.speaker: Brem
56.text: I expect so. And whoever wants him had best bring a heap of coin.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Here's my offer: give me your slave, or become mine.

35.speaker: Brem
35.text: Hey - I was just looking to make a little coin. Ain't after a mess.

8.speaker: Brem
8.text: Counter-offer. Come back with coin, and I'll pretend you're as scary as you think you are.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Art's more valuable once the creator is dead. I can arrange that.

82.speaker: Brem
82.text: What, kill him and the price of his drawings goes up? Bloody clever, that.

29.speaker: Brem
29.text: Go on, then - but don't kill him here. He's going to be a bleater, I know it.

103.speaker: Brem
103.text: What, reckon I can't deal with him myself? It's not a bad idea, mind...

2.speaker: Brem
2.text: But we've gabbed enough. You got something to trade or what?

114.speaker: Player
114.text: If this artist were to tragically expire, his portfolio would become finite - therefore priceless.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Slavekeeping's bad for business with any halfway-moral customer. Let him go.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Forget the artist - do you have anything else to trade?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Sounds fair. I'll take a portrait, then.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Do you have anything else to trade?

106.speaker: Brem
106.text: Of course. Got some interesting stock for a friend of the family.

51.speaker: Brem
51.text: Plenty, if the finer things don't appeal.

33.speaker: Brem
33.text: Can't show you the good stuff 'til Zarys gives the say-so, mind. Friends of the Zhent only.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I do cut a fine figure. I'll take one.

57.speaker: Brem
57.text: You've got an eye for quality. Every noble in Baldur's Gate will be after one of these.

61.speaker: Brem
61.text: Tell him I sent you - and if he stains it up with his sniffling, there'll be hell to pay.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: No, thanks - I just want to trade.

71.speaker: Brem
71.text: If you have the gold, my pet artist will make you a most heroical likeness. Follow the whining.

108.speaker: Brem
108.text: Something I can help you with?
